attributes.action: We would like for South Harrow to be written in Tamil under the English signage.
attributes.additional_details:
Because of the amount of population and business run by one community in South Harrow.
Because as one community we bring a lot to the table by paying business tax and a lot of Tamil voters.
attributes.background: As of the Tamil population in South Harrow in London and most business run by Tamil's in that area we would like South Harrow to be written in Tamil under the English signage (as done in Punjabi in Southall).

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about local signs are a matter for the relevant local authority, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
